001package org.relationlearn.filters;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
006import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
007import java.net.MalformedURLException;
008import java.net.URL;
009import java.net.URLClassLoader;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.Comparator;
012import java.util.LinkedList;
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.PriorityQueue;
015import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
016import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser;
017import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory;
018import org.xml.sax.Attributes;
019import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
020import org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler;
021import weka.core.FastVector;
022import weka.core.Instance;
023import weka.core.Instances;
024
025/**
026 * Implementation of FilterGroup which applies the TextFilter objects 
027 * to the input in the same order they were added to group and in a 
028 * sequential manner.
029 * 
030 * <p>
031 * <h3>Configuration file options</h3>
032 * Apart adding filters through code you can also supply an XML file
033 * which will contain your desired filter configuration to be used
034 * wihtout adding them manually by code.<br/> The code
035 * below is an example of all the possible input formats:
036 * </p>
037 * <pre>
038 * {@code
039 * <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
040 * <filters>
041 *     <filter id="1" name="filter_name" local="yes" relative="no" 
042 *         classpath="file:/C:/your/absolute/path/here">
043 *     class.fully.qualified.name
044 *     </filter>
045 *     <filter id="4" name="filter_name" local="yes" relative="yes" 
046 *         classpath="your/relative/path/here">
047 *      class.fully.qualified.name
048 *     </filter>
049 *     <filter id="3" name="filter_name" local="no" classpath="your_url_here">
050 *      class.fully.qualified.name
051 *     </filter>
052 * </filters>
053 * }
054 * </pre>
055 * <p>
056 * You can basically have two types of filter configurations: local filters and
057 * remote filters. Local filters can then be found using a relative path or
058 * an absolute path, both Windows and Linux path separators work directly with 
059 * this system, so only  you need to input the path the same way the 
060 * system represents it.
061 * <p/>
062 * <p>
063 * For remote paths your path is the URL addres where the base directory for
064 * the sources or the .jar file are located.
065 * </p>
066 * <p> 
067 * The id attribute only defines the priority of the filter being
068 * {@link java.lang.Integer#MIN_VALUE} the one with the hightest priority and
069 * {@link java.lang.Integer#MAX_VALUE} the value with less priority. Although
070 * its recommended that you begin identifying your filters with the value 1 
071 * for the first, 2 for the second and so on.
072 * </p>
073 * 
074 * @see java.net.URLClassLoader
075 * @see FilterGroup
076 * @see TextFilter
077 */
078public class SequentialFilterGroup implements FilterGroup {
079    
080    private static class FilterItem {
081        
082        public final TextFilter FILTER;
083        public final Integer ID;
084        
085        private FilterItem() {
086            this(null, -1);
087        }
088        
089        public FilterItem(TextFilter filter, Integer id) {
090            this.FILTER = filter;
091            this.ID = id;
092        }
093    }
094    
095    private static class ItemComparator implements Comparator<FilterItem> {
096
097        @Override
098        public int compare(FilterItem item1, FilterItem item2) {
099            return item1.ID.compareTo(item2.ID);
100        }
101        
102    }
103    
104    private class SAXParserHelper extends DefaultHandler {
105        
106        private final String FILTER_TAG = "filter";
107        
108        private final String ID_ATTR = "id";
109        private final String NAME_ATTR = "name";
110        private final String LOCAL_ATTR = "local";
111        private final String RELATIVE_ATTR = "relative";
112        private final String CLASSPATH_ATTR = "classpath";
113        
114        private final String VALUE_NO = "no";
115        private final String VALUE_YES = "yes";
116        
117        private final PriorityQueue<FilterItem> ITEM_QUEUE;
118        private final List<TextFilter> PARSED_FILTERS;
119        
120        private int filterOrder;
121        private String filterName;
122        private String classPath;
123        
124        private String currentClass;
125        
126        public SAXParserHelper() {
127            this.ITEM_QUEUE = new PriorityQueue(11, new ItemComparator());
128            this.PARSED_FILTERS = new LinkedList<>();
129        }
130        
131        @Override
132        public void startElement(String uri, String localName, String qName, 
133                Attributes attributes) throws SAXException {
134            
135            if(FILTER_TAG.equals(qName)) {
136                parseFilterAttributes(attributes);
137            }
138        }
139        
140        @Override
141        public void characters(char[] ac, int i, int j) {
142            currentClass = new String(ac, i, j).trim();
143        }
144        
145        @Override
146        public void endElement(String uri, String localName, String qName) 
147                throws SAXException {
148            if(FILTER_TAG.equals(qName)) {
149                TextFilter filter = tryLoadFilter(classPath);
150                FilterItem item = new FilterItem(filter, filterOrder);
151                ITEM_QUEUE.add(item);
152            }
153        }
154        
155        public List<TextFilter> getParsingResults() {
156            if(ITEM_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
157                while(ITEM_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
158                    PARSED_FILTERS.add(ITEM_QUEUE.poll().FILTER);
159                }
160            }
161            return this.PARSED_FILTERS;
162        }
163        
164        private void parseFilterAttributes(Attributes attr) 
165                throws SAXException {
166            String id, name, local, relative, classpath;
167            id = attr.getValue(ID_ATTR);
168            name = attr.getValue(NAME_ATTR);
169            local = attr.getValue(LOCAL_ATTR);
170            relative = attr.getValue(RELATIVE_ATTR);
171            classpath = attr.getValue(CLASSPATH_ATTR);
172            if((id != null) && (name != null) && (local != null) && 
173                    (classpath != null)) {
174                filterOrder = Integer.valueOf(id);
175                filterName = name;
176                switch(local) {
177                    case VALUE_YES:
178                        if(null != relative) {
179                            switch (relative) {
180                                case VALUE_YES:
181                                    classPath = convertRelativePath(classpath);
182                                    break;
183                                case VALUE_NO:
184                                    classPath = classpath;
185                                    break;
186                                default:
187                                    throw new SAXException("Error: relative "
188                                        + "attribute must be set when local "
189                                        + "attribute value is set to {yes} !");
190                            }
191                        } else {
192                            throw new SAXException("Error: relative attribute "
193                                    + "value must be {yes} or {no} !"); 
194                        }
195                        break;
196                    case VALUE_NO:
197                        classPath = classpath;
198                        break;
199                    default:
200                        throw new SAXException("Error: local attribute values "
201                                + "must be {yes} or {no}");
202                }
203            } else {
204                throw new SAXException("Error: filter tag is missing "
205                        + "one or more necessary attributes!");
206            }
207        }
208        
209        private String convertRelativePath(String relPath) throws SAXException {
210            String absPath;
211            File f = new File(relPath);
212            absPath = f.toURI().normalize().toString();
213            return absPath;
214        }
215        
216        private TextFilter tryLoadFilter(String path) throws SAXException {
217            TextFilter tf = null;
218            try {
219                URL[] urls = { new URL(path) };
220                URLClassLoader ucl = new URLClassLoader(urls);
221                Class<TextFilter> c;
222                c = (Class<TextFilter>) ucl.loadClass(currentClass)
223                        .asSubclass(TextFilter.class);
224                Constructor<TextFilter> con = c.getConstructor(String.class);
225                tf = con.newInstance(filterName);
226                ucl.close();
227            } catch (MalformedURLException muex) {
228                throw new SAXException("Error: path doesn't correspond to a "
229                        + "valid system path/URL");
230            } catch (ClassNotFoundException | NoSuchMethodException | 
231                    SecurityException | InstantiationException | 
232                    IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | 
233                    InvocationTargetException | IOException ex) {
234                throw new SAXException(ex);
235            }
236            return tf;
237        }
238    }
239    
240    private final String GROUP_DATASET;
241    private final FastVector FILTER_ATTRS;
242    private final List<TextFilter> FILTERS;
243    
244    private Instances filterDataset;
245    
246    private boolean changedFilter;
247    
248    /** 
249     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the 
250     * dataset name "test-dataset" without any filter
251     * added.
252     */
253    public SequentialFilterGroup() {
254        this("test-dataset");
255    }
256    
257    /**
258     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name
259     * {@code dataset} without any filter added.
260     * 
261     * @param dataset the name of this SequentialFilterGroup dataset
262     */
263    public SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset) {
264        this.GROUP_DATASET = dataset;
265        this.FILTER_ATTRS = new FastVector();
266        this.FILTERS = new ArrayList<>();
267        this.filterDataset = new Instances(dataset, FILTER_ATTRS, 0);
268        this.changedFilter = true;
269    }
270    
271    /**
272     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name
273     * {@code dataset}, and, using the information found in
274     * {@code configFile}, loads all specified TextFilter objects and
275     * adds them to this SequentialFilterGroup.
276     * 
277     * @param dataset the name of this SequentialFilterGroup dataset
278     * @param configFile the XML file whioh contains the filter configuration
279     * to load onto this SequentialFilterGroup
280     */
281    public SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset, File configFile) {
282        this(dataset);
283        loadFiltersFromFile(configFile);
284    }
285    
286    @Override
287    public String getGroupDatasetName() {
288        return GROUP_DATASET;
289    }
290
291    @Override
292    public FastVector getGroupAttributes() {
293        return FILTER_ATTRS;
294    }
295
296    @Override
297    public Instance createInstanceUsingFilters(String r, String h) {
298        buildInstances();
299        Instance instance = new Instance(FILTER_ATTRS.size());
300        for(TextFilter filter : FILTERS) {
301            instance.setValue(filter.getMappedAttribute(), 
302                    filter.filter(r, h));
303        }
304        instance.setDataset(filterDataset);
305        return instance;
306    }
307
308    @Override
309    public void addFilter(TextFilter filter) {
310        changedFilter = true;
311        FILTER_ATTRS.addElement(filter.getMappedAttribute());
312        FILTERS.add(filter);
313    }
314    
315    private void buildInstances() {
316        if(changedFilter) {
317            filterDataset = new Instances(GROUP_DATASET, FILTER_ATTRS, 0);
318            changedFilter = false;
319        }
320    }
321    
322    private void loadFiltersFromFile(File configFile) {
323        SAXParserFactory factory = SAXParserFactory.newInstance();
324        SAXParserHelper helper = new SAXParserHelper();
325        try {
326            SAXParser parser = factory.newSAXParser();
327            parser.parse(configFile, helper);
328        } catch (ParserConfigurationException | SAXException | 
329                IOException mex) {
330            throw new IllegalArgumentException(mex);
331        }
332        
333        for(TextFilter filter : helper.getParsingResults()) {
334            this.addFilter(filter);
335        }
336    }
337
338}
